correctResponse.value: <html><body class="feedback"> Most digital fans contain a computer to remember the settings that a person has given it and control the motor to reflect those settings. </body></html>

<html><body class="feedback">
Video game consoles contain computers processors. In fact, the manufacturers of the latest generation of the consoles are hoping that their consoles will take over most, if not all, of the duties of a family's home computer. </body></html>

<html><body class="feedback"> While an older fan uses electricity, it contains only simple switches and components change what is getting fed to the motor. There isn't anything that people would call a computer. </body></html>

<html><body class="feedback"> Modern soldiers carry many computers to help them with the myriad of tasks they need to do.
</body></html>
<html><body class="feedback"> A pencil is a piece of wood, some graphite, and maybe an eraser! There isn't a computer in there! </body></html>
<html><body class="feedback"> Right, a modern car contains several computers: the CD player, for instance! </body></html>
<html><body class="feedback"> Right, a cell phone definitely contains computers. </body></html>

<html><body class="feedback">
Yes, video game consoles are most definitely computers. In fact, the manufacturers of the latest generation of the consoles are hoping that their consoles to take over most, if not all, of the duties of a family's home computer. </body></html>

<html><body class="feedback"> Digital fans need to remember the settings that a person has given it, and control the motor to reflect those settings, make beeps when an error occurs, and so forth. This is a clear indication of computing power. </body></html>

<html><body class="feedback"> Right, an older fan only contains simple electrical components. There isn't anything that people would call a computer.
</body></html>

<html><body class="feedback"> Modern soldiers carry many computers to help them with the myriad of tasks they need to do. In fact, they often have a "ruggedized" laptop computer that operates a lot like a business person's laptop. </body></html>
<html><body class="feedback"> Right. No computer in there. </body></html>
<html><body class="feedback"> A modern car contains several computers: e.g., to sense and control the engine, to operate the radio and CD player, and so forth. </body></html>

<html><body class="feedback"> A modern cell phone definitely contains computers: they need to send digital information to the towers that link them to the greater network, they often run games, most often have a calculator tool, and so forth. </body></html>

gapMatchInteraction.prompt:
<html><body class="matchprompt" style="font-size:14px; font-family:Verdana, Arial,Helvetica; width:550px; margin:20px 0 10px 0 ; color:#0000FF; line-height:120%;">
Which of the following items contain a computer?</body></html>
gapMatchInteraction.gapMultiple: <html><body class="slot">Items that contain one or more computers:</body></html>
<html><body class="slot">Items that do not contain a computer:</body></html>
